title: 2-year-old shot and killed in Stone Mountain, aunt and uncle arrested
content:
STONE MOUNTAIN, GA (CBS46) -
A 2-year-old child was shot and killed in Stone Mountain. His aunt and uncle have now been charged in connection to his death.
Stone Mountain police received a call to a house on Third Street shortly after 10 Monday morning.
That's where they found 2-year-old Kamarri Lewis dead.
Kamarri's aunt and uncle have been arrested and charged in connection to the crime.
Police arrested 23-year-old Alexia Thomas and charged her with cruelty to children, possession of cocaine and reckless conduct.
Detray Shivers, 25, also faces the same charges, as well as tampering with evidence.
Police said they found the weapon involved, a semi-automatic handgun, outside in a storm drain.
Police said Shivers was the one who threw the gun in the storm drain.
One family member, who did not want to be identified, couldn't believe how quickly Kamarri's life slipped away.
"My little brother played football with him yesterday. He was like I was just playing with him. He's not here anymore."
Officers said Thomas found him inside the home, but he'd already passed. She told police she was sleeping when the child was shot.
"I've never seen a weapon inside the home," said Thomas. "I don't know how to respond. I'm still in shock. This is crazy. I don't know how to respond."
Police said a single gunshot took the child's life, and unfortunately took the entire neighborhood by surprise.
